metadata.title: CVE-2020-8112 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
opj_t1_clbl_decode_processor in openjp2/t1.c in OpenJPEG 2.3.1 through2020-01-28 has a heap-based buffer overflow in the qmfbid==1 case, adifferent issue than CVE-2020-6851.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-8112` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4
libopenjp2-tools - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4
libopenjp3d7 - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4
libopenjpip-server - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4
libopenjpip7 - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.1-1ubuntu4').
insighttoolkit4 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
qtwebengine-opensource-src package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
blender package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
texmaker package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
